name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Michigan research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Michigan ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Michigan ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Michigan research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Michigan research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Michigan Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ FS—Michigan, My Michigan—50:11

  2. Get an overview of Michigan research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Michigan Overview—1:04

  3. Follow this research study for Michigan ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Michigan Research, 1880-Present

  4. Learn about resources for Michigan research.

    ☆ AR—Resources for Michigan Research

  5. Ancestry: Explore resources for Michigan research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Michigan Resources
    ☆ AC—Michigan State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Michigan Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Michigan Record Finder

  7. Watch this video to learn how to put your research into historical context.

    ☆ AAC—Putting Your Research Into Historical Context—5:17

    8. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Michigan in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Michigan

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Michigan African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Michigan.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Michigan in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Michigan
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

1. Explore Michigan historical resources on FamilySearch.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Michigan archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Michigan archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Michigan archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Michigan Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Michigan State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn about online and archive resources in these videos.

    ☆ AAC—Online Treasures—4:45
    ☆ AAC—Offline Resources: Records & Repositories—4:33

  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Michigan.
  4. Explore the Michiganology site.
  5. Explore Library of Michigan collection.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Michigan genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Michigan research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Michigan ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Michigan city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Michigan Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Michigan city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Michigan city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Michigan ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Michigan city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Michigan vital and census records.

hidden.summary:
• Find online resources for vital records.
  • Learn the history of vital records in the state of Michigan.
  • Learn about alternates for vital records in Michigan.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Michigan Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Michigan Vital Records

  2. Get started with Michigan vital records in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Getting Started: Vital Records—6:14

  3. Learn more about Michigan vital records and search for them, on the Michiganology site.

    ☆ Vital Records

  4. Explore links for vital records on the Michigan Dept. of Health site.
  5. Search for online Michigan ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  6. Explore Michigan birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  7. Explore additional links for Michigan vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

  4. Explore additional links for Michigan death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.

    • QUIKLinks

text: QUIKLinks

1. Search for ☆Michigan historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Michigan newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Michigan Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Michigan newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Michigan newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Michigan newspapers and obituaries on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  7. Explore the Digital Michigan ​Newspaper Portal.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Michigan research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Michigan County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Michigan.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Michigan Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Michigan research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Michigan Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Michigan Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Michigan Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Michigan.
Regional/Local Societies

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Michigan research.
  2. Explore the Michigan research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Michigan research.
  4. Explore Michigan research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

1. Learn about genealogy societies in Michigan in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Michigan Societies

  2. Learn about genealogy societies in Michigan in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Michigan Societies

  3. Explore Michigan genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Michigan.
